description.zh-cn: 坐落于中国北京市海淀区玉渊潭公园东侧的一处古代皇家园林及现代国宾馆建筑群，常作为中华人民共和国政府接待来访外国元首及政府首脑的场所。
description.en: An ancient royal garden and modern state guesthouse complex located on the east side of Yuyuantan Park in Haidian District, Beijing, China. It is often used by the Chinese government to host visiting foreign heads of state and government.

description.zh-cn: 金朝第六位皇帝，曾在钓鱼台国宾馆现址筑台垂钓，“钓鱼台”因此得名。
description.en: The sixth emperor of the Jin dynasty. He built a platform for fishing at the current site of the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse, from which the name 'Diaoyutai' (Fishing Platform) originates.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第六位皇帝。他下令在钓鱼台修建行宫，并将其收为皇家园林。
description.en: The sixth emperor of the Qing dynasty. He ordered the construction of a temporary palace at Diaoyutai and incorporated it as a royal garden.

description.zh-cn: 清朝最后一位皇帝，也是中国历史上最后一位皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Qing dynasty and the final emperor of China.

description.zh-cn: 清末官员，曾任宣统帝溥仪的老师（太傅）。
description.en: An official of the late Qing dynasty who served as the tutor (Grand Tutor) to Emperor Xuantong (Puyi).

en: Government of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的中央政府。
description.en: The central government of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家、政治家、理论家，中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和第一代核心领导人。
description.en: A Chinese communist revolutionary, political theorist and founding father of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家、军事家、外交家，中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要领导人之一，曾任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: A Chinese statesman, military leader, and diplomat who was one of the main leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, serving as the first Premier of the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国外交部

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国外交部
en: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政府负责外交事务的组成部门。
description.en: The executive agency of the government of the People's Republic of China responsible for foreign affairs.

description.zh-cn: 1966年至1976年间由毛泽东发动和领导的政治运动。
description.en: A political movement initiated and led by Mao Zedong from 1966 to 1976.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间设立的机构，一度取代中共中央政治局成为实际的权力核心，其办公地点设在钓鱼台国宾馆。
description.en: An organization established during the Cultural Revolution, which for a time replaced the Politburo of the CCP Central Committee as the de facto center of power. Its offices were located at the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，中共八大元老之一，曾任文化革命五人小组组长。
description.en: A Chinese politician, one of the Eight Elders of the Communist Party of China, and former head of the Group of Five in Charge of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 全称为《文化革命五人小组关于当前学术讨论的汇报提纲》，由彭真在钓鱼台国宾馆组织起草。
description.en: Fully titled 'Outline Report on the Current Academic Discussion of the Group of Five in Charge of the Cultural Revolution', it was drafted under the organization of Peng Zhen at the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，文化大革命的主要发动者之一，中央文革小组成员。
description.en: A Chinese politician, one of the main instigators of the Cultural Revolution, and a member of the Central Cultural Revolution Group.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，曾任毛泽东的政治秘书，后成为中央文革小组组长。
description.en: A Chinese politician who served as Mao Zedong's political secretary and later became the head of the Central Cultural Revolution Group.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，毛泽东的第四任妻子，“四人帮”核心成员，中央文革小组主要成员。
description.en: A Chinese political figure, the fourth wife of Mao Zedong, a core member of the 'Gang of Four', and a key member of the Central Cultural Revolution Group.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，“四人帮”成员之一，中央文革小组成员。
description.en: A Chinese politician, a member of the 'Gang of Four', and a member of the Central Cultural Revolution Group.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家、作家，“四人帮”成员之一，中央文革小组成员。
description.en: A Chinese politician and writer, a member of the 'Gang of Four', and a member of the Central Cultural Revolution Group.

description.zh-cn: 中国哲学家、政治人物，中央文革小组成员。
description.en: A Chinese philosopher and political figure, and a member of the Central Cultural Revolution Group.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命后期由江青、张春桥、姚文元、王洪文组成的政治集团。
description.en: A political faction composed of Jiang Qing, Zhang Chunqiao, Yao Wenyuan, and Wang Hongwen during the later stages of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，曾任国务院副总理，在文革期间居住于钓鱼台国宾馆。
description.en: A Chinese politician who served as Vice Premier of the State Council and resided at the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，中华人民共和国第二代核心领导人，改革开放的总设计师。
description.en: A Chinese politician who was the paramount leader of the People's Republic of China from 1978 to 1989 and the chief architect of Reform and Opening-up.

description.zh-cn: 由钓鱼台国宾馆在茅台镇投资生产的酱香型白酒品牌。
description.en: A brand of sauce-aroma style baijiu produced in Maotai Town, invested in by the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，曾任中华人民共和国国务院总理、全国人民代表大会常务委员会委员长。
description.en: A Chinese politician who served as the Premier of the People's Republic of China and the Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress.

description.zh-cn: 香港商人和政治家，香港特别行政区首任行政长官。
description.en: A Hong Kong businessman and politician who was the first Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治家，第40任美国总统。
description.en: An American politician who served as the 40th president of the United States.

description.zh-cn: 英国政治家，1979年至1990年任英国首相。
description.en: A British stateswoman who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1979 to 1990.

description.zh-cn: 俄罗斯政治家，现任俄罗斯总统。
description.en: A Russian politician and current president of Russia.

nodes.id: 外交部钓鱼台国宾馆管理局

zh-cn: 外交部钓鱼台国宾馆管理局

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国外交部直属事业单位，加挂钓鱼台国宾馆牌子，负责钓鱼台国宾馆管理工作。
description.en: A public institution directly under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China, also branded as Diaoyutai State Guesthouse, responsible for its management.

description.zh-cn: 金章宗在位期间（西元1190年至1208年）在此地筑台垂钓，“钓鱼台”因此得名，为其历史渊源。
description.en: During his reign (1190-1208 AD), Emperor Zhangzong built a platform for fishing at this location, from which the name 'Diaoyutai' originates, marking its historical roots.

description.zh-cn: 乾隆二十八年（1763年），敕命在此兴建行宫，并将其收为皇家园林，进一步发展了该地。
description.en: In the 28th year of the Qianlong reign (1763), he ordered the construction of a temporary palace here and designated it as a royal garden, further developing the site.

description.zh-cn: 陈宝琛曾担任溥仪的太傅（老师）。
description.en: Chen Baochen served as Puyi's Grand Tutor.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命后，溥仪在出宫前把钓鱼台内的“养源斋”赐给了陈宝琛。
description.en: After the Xinhai Revolution and before leaving the Forbidden City, Puyi gifted the 'Yangyuan Zhai' (Studio of Nourishing Origins) within Diaoyutai to Chen Baochen.

description.zh-cn: 为庆祝建国10周年和接待来访外国元首，于1958年至1959年在古钓鱼台风景区基础上扩大修建，建成现代的国宾馆。
description.en: To celebrate the 10th anniversary of the founding of the PRC and to host visiting foreign heads of state, the government expanded and constructed the modern guesthouse on the basis of the ancient Diaoyutai scenic area from 1958 to 1959.

description.zh-cn: 与周恩来一同决定选址古钓鱼台风景区，责成外交部营建国宾馆。
description.en: Together with Zhou Enlai, he decided on the location of the ancient Diaoyutai scenic area and instructed the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to build the state guesthouse.

description.zh-cn: 与毛泽东一同决定选址古钓鱼台风景区，责成外交部营建国宾馆。
description.en: Together with Mao Zedong, he decided on the location of the ancient Diaoyutai scenic area and instructed the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to build the state guesthouse.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国外交部

description.zh-cn: 受毛泽东、周恩来责成，具体组织、筹划并营建了钓鱼台国宾馆。
description.en: Under the instruction of Mao Zedong and Zhou Enlai, it specifically organized, planned, and constructed the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse.

description.zh-cn: 1966年初，在钓鱼台国宾馆组织写作班子起草《二月提纲》。
description.en: In early 1966, he organized a writing team at the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse to draft the 'February Outline'.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命时期，钓鱼台国宾馆成为中央文化革命小组的办公和生活驻地，是当时的政治权力核心所在地。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse became the office and residence of the Central Cultural Revolution Group, serving as the core of political power at the time.

description.zh-cn: 九大之后，钓鱼台国宾馆成为“四人帮”成员集中的居住和办公处所。
description.en: After the 9th National Congress of the CCP, the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse became the concentrated residence and office for the members of the 'Gang of Four'.

description.zh-cn: 1975年上书毛泽东请求搬出钓鱼台国宾馆，此举动引发了其他居住于此的政治局委员的相继迁出，结束了其作为文革核心人物居住地的角色。
description.en: In 1975, he wrote to Mao Zedong requesting to move out of the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse. This action led to the subsequent departure of other Politburo members residing there, ending its role as the residence for key figures of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 1975年批示同意陈永贵搬出钓鱼台的请求，称“很好，钓鱼台无鱼可钓”，促使其他政治局委员也搬离该地，结束了其作为文革核心人物居住地的角色。
description.en: In 1975, he approved Chen Yonggui's request to move out of Diaoyutai, commenting 'Very good, there are no fish to be caught at the Fishing Platform,' which prompted other Politburo members to leave, ending its role as the residence for key Cultural Revolution figures.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东逝世后，江青才从钓鱼台国宾馆搬到中南海居住。
description.en: Only after Mao Zedong's death did Jiang Qing move from the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse to live in Zhongnanhai.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平执政后，钓鱼台国宾馆继续作为招待访华外宾的重要场所。
description.en: After Deng Xiaoping came to power, the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse continued to serve as an important venue for hosting foreign dignitaries visiting China.

description.zh-cn: 1999年在茅台镇投资设厂，生产酱香型白酒“钓鱼台酒”。
description.en: In 1999, it invested in a factory in Maotai Town to produce the sauce-aroma style baijiu 'Diaoyutai Wine'.

position.zh-cn: 香港特别行政区行政长官
position.en: Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

description.zh-cn: 在钓鱼台国宾馆五号楼向董建华颁发香港特别行政区首任行政长官委任证书。
description.en: Presented Tung Chee-hwa with the certificate of appointment as the first Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region in Villa No. 5 of the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse.

description.zh-cn: 曾居住于钓鱼台国宾馆十二号楼。
description.en: Once resided in Villa No. 12 of the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse.

description.zh-cn: 访问中国时曾下榻于钓鱼台国宾馆十二号楼。
description.en: Stayed at Villa No. 12 of the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse during his visit to China.

description.zh-cn: 访问中国时曾下榻于钓鱼台国宾馆十二号楼。
description.en: Stayed at Villa No. 12 of the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse during her visit to China.

description.zh-cn: 于2023年10月访问中国时入住钓鱼台国宾馆，并在此召开记者会。
description.en: Stayed at the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse and held a press conference there during his visit to China in October 2023.

relationships.source: 外交部钓鱼台国宾馆管理局
relationships.target: 中华人民共和国外交部

description.zh-cn: 是中华人民共和国外交部直属事业单位。
description.en: It is a public institution directly under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China.

relationships.source: 外交部钓鱼台国宾馆管理局

description.zh-cn: 负责钓鱼台国宾馆的管理工作。
description.en: It is responsible for the management of the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse.
